actions.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs ordered to be reported an original measure.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Original measure reported to Senate by Senator Stevens for Senator Roth. With written report No. 104-147. Additional views filed.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 193.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Economic and Educational.

actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Postsecondary Education, Training and Life-Long Learning.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Postsecondary Education, Training and Life-Long Learning

official_title: An original bill to amend the Congressional Award Act to revise and extend authorities for the Congressional Award Board.

summary.text: Congressional Award Act Amendments of 1995 - Amends the Congressional Award Act to extend through 1997 the requirement that the Comptroller General determine that the Director of the Congressional Award Program has ensured that appropriate procedures for fiscal control and fund accounting are established for the financial operations of the Program and that such operations are administered by personnel with expertise in accounting and financial management. Extends the Congressional Award Board until October 1, 1998.

titles.title: An original bill to amend the Congressional Award Act to revise and extend authorities for the Congressional Award Board.
